result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Acevedo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 15CM2204 for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Final pre-trial held.  Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 36.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  
Case adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.
The Forensic Unit was contacted and Dr. Collins will  be appointed to examine the defendant for competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.14(2)(a).  Defendant has an appointment for 09/28/2015 at 10:30 a.m. in the Forensic Unit.  Defendant was instructed by the court to make sure he came to his appointment.
Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 36.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court. Defendant NOT in court. William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case RECALLED. 
Court advised by Deputy in court that defendant is no longer in custody. Court reinstated bail in this matter. Court vacated the Doctor's Report Return date of 8/26/2015, and reset matter for Final Pretrial on 8/25/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 36. Jury Trial date remains vacated. Court continued suspension of proceedings based on the raising of competency by defense counsel. Branch 36 to decided if defendant is to be evaluated for competency at next court date. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court. Defendant NOT in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called at request of Defense Counsel.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Court suspended proceedings. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court VACATED the Final Pretrial & Jury Trial dates and set matter for a return of Doctor's Report in branch 36.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case not called with pending matter 15CM2204, but joined for trial. Dates remain as scheduled.

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JUANITA A.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward Acevedo
Current: 2855 N WEIL ST, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 05-28-2015)
Prior: 3719 West Walnut Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Edward Acevedo in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Edward Acevedo in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
